did.physloc: Collection located offsite; two days notice required for retrieval.
did.abstract: Professor and chairman of the department of neurology of the University of Michigan Medical School and the University Hospital. Papers document his teaching and research and participation in professional organizations.

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library University of Michigan

acqinfo.p: The collection was the gift of Dr. DeJong and came to the library in several accessions beginning in 1962. The donor number for the collection is 255

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

userestrict.p: Copyright has been transferred to the Regents of the University of Michigan.

prefercite.p: item, folder title, box no., Russell N. DeJong papers, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: Russell Nelson DeJong, professor and chairman of the department of neurology of the University of Michigan Medical School and the University Hospital, was born on March 12, 1907, in Orange City, Iowa. He attended Grand Rapids Junior College for two years, then entered the University of Michigan where he received his B.A. in 1929, a Doctor of Medicine degree in 1932, and a Master of Science degree in Neurology in 1936.

In 1932, DeJong joined the staff of the University Hospital as a intern in neurology. He became assistant resident in 1933, instructor in 1934, assistant professor in 1937, associate professor in 1941, and professor and chairman of the neurology department in 1950. As chairman, DeJong enjoyed success both as a recruiter of clinicians and teachers for his department and as an accomplished grantsman acquiring funds to further his and the research interests of his colleagues.

DeJong understood the importance of improving the training given in neurology and the quality of research conducted in the fields of neuroanatomy and neurophysiology. He was the author of The Neurologic Examination and A History of American Neurology, as well as numerous contributions to professional journals. DeJong further demonstrated his belief that the members of his profession should share their research when he accepted the position of editor-in-chief of Neurology. He held this position from 1951 to 1976. In addition, DeJong was neurology editor of the Yearbook of Neurology and Neurology and on the editorial boards of Handbook of Clinical Neurology and of Excerpta Medica. As editor of Neurology, DeJong was noted for his skill both in selecting material and in assisting authors to improve their submissions.

DeJong's accomplishments go beyond his work as a clinician, teacher, and administrator. He was also a researcher of note whose interests were varied. This included research and participation in organizations concerned with multiple sclerosis, Parkinson's disease, migraine, Huntington's Choreaepilepsy, Guillain-Barr√® syndrome. Among the organizations that DeJong actively participation in were the American Epilepsy Association, the National Institute of Neurological Diseases and Blindness, the American Board of Psychiatry and Neurology, the World Federation of Neurology, the American Academy of Neurology, the American Neurological Association, and the National Multiple Sclerosis Society.

list.head: Summary Contents List
list.item:
Professional Organizations (boxes 3-14)
American Academy of Neurology (boxes 3-10)
Other Organizations (boxes 10-14)

scopecontent.p: The Russell DeJong papers documents the activities of an individual who, through his teaching, research, and commitment to his profession, achieved national and international prominence in the field of neurology. The collection has been arranged into six series: Correspondence, Professional Organizations, University of Michigan, Published Papers, Miscellaneous, and Photographs.

The Correspondence series, dating from around 1942 to 1975, is arranged alphabetically within three broad sequences of years. These files include both miscellaneous lettered folders as well as folders for individual correspondents. These files relate to professional activities and interests.

odd.p: (includes people files dating back to the 1950s)
(includes people files dating back to the 1950s)

scopecontent.p: Professional Organizations is the largest series within the collections and concerns DeJong's various activities within the field of neurology. This series is arranged alphabetically by the name of organization. The major portion of this series relates to DeJong's involvement with the American Academy of Neurology, and most particularly with DeJong's editorship of Neurology.

did.unittitle: American Board of Psychiatry and Neurology
Residency Review Committee for Psychiatry and Neurology 1954-1966

odd.p: (mainly reviews of exhibits and responses in question and answer column of AMA journal)

International Congress of Neuro-genetics and Neuro-ophthalmology 1967
International Congress of Neurological Sciences (later International Congress of Neurology) 1957-1969
International Representation of American Neurology, Joint Committee on 1959-1961
Michigan Society of Neurology and Psychiatry 1941-1968
National Committee for the Control of Huntington's Disease and its Consequences 1975-1976
National Conference on Education in the Neurological Sciences 1966
National Institute of Health. Neurology Study Section 1958-1962
National Institute of Neurological Diseases and Blindness (later Neurological Diseases and Stroke 1951-1976
National Research Council, Drug Efficacy Study: Centrally acting muscle relaxants 1966-1969
Residency Review Committee for Psychiatry and Neurology, AMA (University of Chicago review)
U.S. Public Health Service. Neurological and Sensory Disease Service 1962-1967

scopecontent.p: The University of Michigan series consists of materials pertaining to the University of Michigan Department of Neurology and to DeJong's other university activities.

did.unittitle: Intern evaluations of RND and neurology program
Kenneth Campbell Foundation for Neurological Research 1964-1974
Letters of congratulations upon appointment as chairman 1950
Ophthalmology-Search Committee for Head of Dept. of Ophthalmology 1967
Professional Fees-Steering Committee for the Study of Professional Fees

scopecontent.p: Published Papers is a series of DeJong's writings.
The Miscellaneous series is unprocessed and not further described.
The Photograph series consists of portraits of DeJong, collected portraits of other prominent physicians, and photos of DeJong at university and professional meetings.

did.unittitle: Portraits of Russell N. DeJong and other prominent neurologists; photos of RND as part of larger groups
